title: Twenty one women elected to Parliament
byline: Nineteen candidates from the National People’s Power (NPP) and two from the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) have been elected to Parliament this time.

title: Train services arranged for people to return to Colombo after long weekend
byline: Special train services will be operated on Monday (17) and Tuesday (18) to facilitate return travel to Colombo following the long weekend and the Parliamentary elections, the Railways Department announced.

title: Iran to enhance cooperation with Sri Lanka under new govt.
byline: Iranian Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Alireza Delkhosh, has expressed hope for strengthened political, economic, and cultural ties between Iran and Sri Lanka under the country’s newly elected government and parliament.

title: Sufficient SLTB, private buses assigned to transport people to workplaces
byline: A fleet of Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) and private buses have been arranged from today to bring those who had gone out of Colombo to cast their votes.

title: Eight dead after stabbing at school in eastern China
byline: Eight people have died and 17 others have been injured following a stabbing incident outside a school in eastern China.

title: SJB to decide on its National list nominees after Working Committee meeting
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) has said that it will hold a Working Committee meeting to decide on its nominees for the National List, according to a party spokesman.

title: Newly elected MPs asked to register via Parliament website
byline: All Members of Parliament have been requested by Secretary-General of Parliament Kushani Rohanadeera to complete the necessary information by accessing the information link available on the homepage of the Parliament website (www.parliament.lk).

title: NPP nominates National List MPs
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has nominated the list of names to fill the 18 National List seats secured by the NPP in the general election 2024.

title: Sarvajana Balaya nominates Dilith Jayaweera as national list MP
byline: The Sarvajana Balaya (SB) has decided to nominate its leader, Dilith Jayaweera, as its representative for the National List seat in Parliament, according to the party’s General Secretary.

title: SJB will survive tremors: Imtiyaz
byline: While highlighting that the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) may face tremors like the United National Party (UNP) did after its defeat in 1970, SJB Chairman Imthiaz  Bakeer Markar said today that his party will withstand any adverse situation.

title: IMF team to review Sri Lanka’s EFF programme
byline: A delegation from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) is to visit Sri Lanka from November 17 to 23 to conduct the third review under the country’s Extended Fund Facility (EFF) programme.

title: Cabinet Ministers of new Govt. to be sworn in tomorrow
byline: Cabinet Ministers of the new government to be sworn in by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at 10 am tomorrow, November 18, at the Presidential Secretariat, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.
